subcommands.name: tools
subcommands.description: Tools for working with QIIME 2 files.

options.description: Show this message and exit.

Parameter for each metadata column that should be cast as a specified column type (supported types are as follows: categorical, numeric). The required formatting for this parameter is --cast COLUMN:TYPE, repeated for each column and the associated column type it should be cast to in the output. [required]
If this flag is enabled, cast parameters that do not correspond to any of the column names within the provided metadata will be ignored.
If this flag is enabled, failing to include cast parameters for all columns in the provided metadata will result in an error.
Path to file where the modified metadata should be written to.
Show this message and exit.

subcommands.name: export
subcommands.description: Export data from a QIIME 2 Artifact or a Visualization

options.description: Path to file that should be exported [required]
Path to file or directory where data should be exported to [required]
Format which the data should be exported as. This option cannot be used with Visualizations

subcommands.name: extract

options.description: Path to file that should be extracted [required]
Directory where archive should be extracted to

subcommands.name: import
subcommands.description: Import data into a new QIIME 2 Artifact.

options.description: The semantic type of the artifact that will be created upon importing. Use --show-importable-types to see what importable semantic types are available in the current deployment. [required]
Path to file or directory that should be imported.
Path where output artifact should be written.
The format of the data to be imported. If not provided, data must be in the format expected by the semantic type provided via --type.
Show formats that can be supplied to --input-format to import data into an artifact.
Show this message and exit.
Print as machine-readable TSV instead of text.
Show this message and exit.

subcommands.name: validate
subcommands.description: Validate data in a QIIME 2 Artifact.

options.description: Desired level of validation. "min" will perform minimal validation, and "max" will perform maximal validation (at the potential cost of runtime). [default: max]
Show this message and exit.
The extension of the index file that should be opened. [default: html]
